        First Katalyst Marketing Limited is a dynamic marketing communications agency headquartered in Ikeja, Lagos. Established in 2012, we specialize in delivering 360° marketing solutions that help brands connect with consumers, drive demand, and achieve sustainable growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Analyst

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Job Description


	We are recruiting a highly skilled Data Analyst to join our team and be seconded to our client, a leading building solution company based in Ikoyi, Lagos.


Job Summary

	You will be responsible for writing compelling copy, creating visual content, and editing videos that support our brand’s message, engage our audience, and promote our products and services.
	This role requires strong storytelling skills, attention to detail, and the ability to manage projects from concept through completion.

	Develop creative content ideas aligned with our brand and marketing strategy.
	Write and edit engaging blog posts, articles, social media captions, and website copy.
	Plan, shoot, and edit high-quality videos for social media, ads, and web content.
	Design graphics, motion graphics, and other visual assets to complement written content.
	Collaborate with the marketing team to brainstorm and produce campaign content.
	Conduct keyword research and implement SEO best practices to increase organic reach.
	Adapt and repurpose content into various formats (short-form videos, reels, infographics, etc.).
	Ensure all content reflects the brand’s tone, style, and quality standards.
	Monitor trends in digital content and video editing to keep our content fresh and relevant.
	Organize and manage media assets and maintain an up-to-date content library.


Requirements and Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Media, Communications, Film, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of proven experience in content creation and video editing.
	Strong portfolio showcasing your writing, content design, and video editing work.
	Proficiency in video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve).
	Experience with VIDEO EDITING tools (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Da Vinci, Canva).
	Excellent storytelling, writing, and editing skills in English.
	Familiarity with social media platforms (Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Facebook) and content trends.
	Knowledge of SEO principles and how to apply them to digital content.
	Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects under deadlines.
	Creativity, attention to detail, and a proactive approach to content planning.
	Animation or motion graphics and photography skills are a plus.


Salary
N150,000 / Month.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Employment type: Full-time

Job&nbsp;Overview / Summary


	The Travel Assistant is a short-term position and under the supervision of the Senior Travel Officer,
	is responsible for all travel bookings request processes centralized in Abuja with little support
	extended to other locations remotely. She/He will work with the travel team in providing travel
	support to all IRC Nigeria staff and visitors.

The responsibilities may include but are not limited to:
Bookings:


	Responsible for booking of both local and international commercial flights for IRC staff and&nbsp;visitor through IRC registered travel agent.

	Work hand in hand with Admin Officer to coordinate all related travel support for expatriates and visitors.

	Compile the country program&rsquo;s movement plan on daily basis (to cover weekends and&nbsp;holidays) and share with Supply Chain Focal Point by COB.

	Update trackers for all commercial flight bookings, UNHAS bookings and hotel
	accommodation in Abuja. Store same on Box&reg; folders.
	Ensure that all travel requests to the travel agent is tracked by a unique identification code.
	Using reporting journal, send monthly report on UNHAS bookings to Finance.
	Work with the Admin/Liaison Officer in consolidating payment report.
	Attend and contribute to meetings with Global Supply Chain focal points on travels. Where needed share country reports on travels.


Compliance and Communication:


	Ensure that all travel request documents comply to travel SOPs before booking and flag up any compliance concerns to the Admin Manager
	Ensure that the regional and global travel agents comply with the Service Level Agreement (SLA) and country agreement especially on service charges and exchange rates.
	Carry out orientation for staff on travel SOPs as required and share new development on travel related activities as the need arises.


Other Duties:


	Any other duty as may be assigned by Supervisor.
	Position Reports to: Senior Travel Officer


Other Internal and/or external contacts:


	Internal: IRC Staff and Visitors
	External: UNHAS (WFP), Hotels, and Travel Agents


Job Requirements
Education and Work Experience:


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in relevant field.
	Administrative &amp; Logistics/Supply Chain qualifications highly desirable.


Demonstrated Skills and Competencies:


	Prior experience of travel services &amp; bookings, domestic and international flights desirable
	Computer literacy to enable updating of computerized databases and tracking sheets.
	Good organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks and competing workloads.
	Knowledge of IRC systems and processes an advantage.
	Ability to work as part of a team and provide superior customer services.


Compensation &amp; Benefits


	Competitive salary package commensurate with experience.
	Health insurance and pension contributions.
	Opportunities for career advancement within a growing offshore services company.
	Exposure to high-value international projects and financial reporting.

	The HR Admin Intern will provide essential support to the Human Resources and Administration department.
	He/she will assist in recruitment, employee record management, and day-to-day administrative tasks to ensure smooth operations.
	This role is ideal for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in HR processes, office administration, and organizational operations within a humanitarian context.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in posting job vacancies on relevant platforms.
	Screen resumes and applications for open positions.
	Schedule and coordinate interviews with candidates.
	Maintain recruitment tracking sheets and databases.
	Assist in maintaining accurate and up-to-date employee records (both digital and physical).
	Assist in the onboarding process for new hires, including preparing orientation materials.
	Support the HR team in ensuring compliance with organizational policies and labour laws.
	Assist in organizing and maintaining office files, documents, and supplies.
	Support in the preparation of HR-related reports and documents
	Help coordinate staff meetings, training sessions, and workshops.
	Serve as a point of contact for HR-related inquiries from staff and candidates.
	Assist in drafting and disseminating internal communications (e.g., memos, announcements). 
	Liaise with other departments to ensure smooth administrative operations.
	Other duties as assigned by the HR Manager or Supervisor.


Requirement


	A recent graduate with a degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Social Sciences, or a related field.
	A Strong interest in humanitarian work and HR practices.
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.
	Fluency in English (written and spoken); knowledge of Hausa or other local languages is an advantage.
	Willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment. and meet deadlines.


Essential:


	Computer skills, especially in Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Excel.
	Knowledge of HRIS and other HR tools will be an added advantage.
	Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
	Excellent organizational and time management skills.
